text:
<@U7SL518D6> :thinking_face:, what do you think if we move the testing version to a different published version in the chrome store?
That way we make much more easier for the tester run the version with 0 effort.
The cons could be more fragmentation but we can always add an extra warning or something like that.

I’d be okay with it. @here who all would be interested in beta testing the extension if we had 2 versions of the extension in the chrome web store, one for the beta version and one for the stable version?

And before anyone shouts about using (at)here it should only ping 23 people who have expressed interest in the extension previously by joining the channel. If I annoyed any of you, let me know and I’ll refrain from doing it again down the road.

nevermind (at)here is disabled in this channel as well still would appreciate people signaling if there is interest. I will also put a message in <#C22PJ878V|random> as there are more people there, - I don’t want to spam <#C22PU4LV8|general>
I would say if we went that route, lets make the beta version private

probably a good idea, think there was a setting for that.

I think it would be fine to link to from the github but you’re right we don’t want people searching the web store and unintentionally installing the wrong one.

I think too - if we go that route, I’m going to look into how to make it so we can publish as a group instead of it just being me. I was reading up on it over the weekend. It seems it is possible, but I do have some concerns, I’ll look into it more and and relay back
Yea exactly
I think its a Google group you should be able to invite people to
Or you create a google group

you’re correct - my concern was just with security, I’ve had a google group get compromised(someone managed to break their way into a google group and added themselves, throwing spam everywhere) a long time ago. Though I generally trust Google it just feels that they stopped caring about that product.

Just want to make sure someone can’t hijack the extension and do something malicious
well, on my side I have two steps and a really tedious password to write from the mobile so group seems like a good option for me :grin:
k lol
I was told to throw emotes here for the beta
:joy:
Well I’ll work on getting it set up and see how I can transfer the extension to the google group without breaking the updates for existing users. - should have that set up within the next couple days
gonna do a list of interested people and keep it up to date for future references
great! thanks

In the near future we will have a private extension for beta tester.
Thank you for your support! :orange_heart:

Interested!
Interested!

and glad to have your assistance Matt! :smile:
Oh hey <@U6GNQ7JBU>
Just invited you
definitely digging the HS developer interest happening
I never knew how much I wanted this

Thoughts for something that I think would be cool b/c I’m lazy, but being able to click to go directly to the template in the DM from the in-page editor. Especially since the new(ish) page editor has kind of buried access to the template under the Advanced Settings accordion. 

Idk how to go about building it or if anyone else would find that helpful, but it would save me a couple of clicks.

actually I’ve had a similar idea regarding the custom modules themselves (being able to inject buttons to pull up the custom modules in the design manager from the edit modules pane)

Regarding your specific idea and use case:
We might be able to get an edit template button to appear like in the top bar of the page editor.
I definitely like the idea of having that access to custom modules as well, that would save so many clicks as well.
So with the dev extension, how does one go about contributing lol? my knowledge of GitHub is very bare minimum

<@U6GNQ7JBU> controls adding people as contributors, I think though anyone can technically submit a PR.

I don’t know if there’s a way to allow contributors easier
Yea, i'm trying to basically figure out some GitHub stuff first. I dont wanna start adding to something only to mess it up. Gonna hop on that Pluralsight subscribiton
I think github has their own tutorial git repo thing

so you can learn the basics there  free. Then on the repo we have basic guidelines for doing updates but it’s going to have  to be updated a little since we’ve got the beta version of the extension getting it’s own chrome store edition
also if you have any git questions - feel free to post em in the slack channel, I’m not a git master (pun not intended lol) but I know how to do most of the common stuff pretty well
I miss having the editor automatically close your html tags.
y’know that’s a good observation that did disappear.

I think that particular feature is one that HubSpot should solve themselves, doing it in the extension could be a little dangerous. I passed it onto Shawn Bristow  - theres something related that they might be doing
Thanks for sending that along. On another note, have you ever considered getting one of those gaming keyboards with a ton of extra keys and mapping them all to web dev macros?
I want a button that just types “{% if  %}”

haha I have one of those keyboards but don’t bring it to work because I think my coworkers would murder me - it’s mechanical.

clickety clack clickity clack!
Mechanical or nuthin!
I typed that on a silent mac keyboard

haha.

But yes we can do keyboard shortcuts through the extension but we do have limitations to what the key combos are
If it’s okay for the account managers to yell in my ear all day then I should be able to have a mechanical keyboard.
It would be so cool if you could flip a little switch on the keyboard to switch between hubl, html, css etc.
I always found the automatic tag closing more irritating than helpful. It's annoying when you're trying to put html around an existing string of text.
I've got a plugin in Visual Studio Code that closes html tags when I type `</`, that's much more helpful imo.
Yes! That’s the better way to do it. I have that in Sublime.
Yeah, I think I got used to it when I used Sublime.
`git clone url` with the url of the repo.
`git pull` to make sure you are up to date
`git checkout -b branch-name` to create and switch to a branch
`git status` to see what branch/changes you have staged
`git add .` to add all files to the commit
`git merge` then pray to merge two branches together - the prayers are that you dont conflict
`git commit -m "Commit message"` to commit changes
`git push origin HEAD` to push the branch to github where you can create a PR
you can also download the git client if all of these commands get scary, it does all of these things but gives you a UI - it’s good for those just getting familiar with git
Just slack me your github user name if you want to be added as a contributor
I think Jon meant me above^^^^
woops sorry lol think I was reading a post from Matt while typing

hot danm, there were 25 installations of the chrome extension just yesterday. that’s the most we’ve had since launching which was 18.

Holy… We’re at 91 current users.(as of yesterday stats are delayed 1 day)
fun/interesting facts. While 91 users is still a small sampling of HubSpot Devs, it appears Macs are the most common OS. With only 29 users on Windows, 2 rebels on linux
All of our devs got wind of it yesterday and installed it.
All 25 of them
actually it’s about 7
it was just <@U26DA9CQ0> with 25 virtual instances of iOS loading the extension repeatedly in chrome
now if only we could convince people to rate and review :joy: <https://spin.d.pr/KhYCZn+>
Yeah I multi-box to artificially inflate conversion rates
And I also need the dev tools on each one
For….
development
haha, you never know when you’re going to need a cache buster :ghost:
Speaking of that, are template changes being cached now?

sorry end of day
Speaking of that, are templates ~changes~ being cached now?
Going to defer to the king of caching <@U6GNQ7JBU>
:dollar: :crown:
No idea, is this a good or bad thing?
Maybe you should add an obnoxious popup that asks people to review it every hour.
Can you add me as well? My github account is jwolfjim.
Not great, I think that the content wasn’t changing unless I cleared the cache, which could be bad if a client needs to change something quickly.
Can’t promise I will make any changes soon but I noticed a small issue with a notification on the dark theme in DM2.
When a template is updated it should invalidate all pages that depend on the template
Pete here’s how you’d know if it was a caching issue, if you use the cache buster button in the extension and it DOES update (sorry mistyped)
<@U7SL518D6> That was the case afaik. I’m going to keep an eye out for it happening again.

if it was that - that’s what the cache buster button is intended for.

it’s better than breaking HubSpots ability to cache all-together
Agreed, but I think changing a headline in the page editor should automatically clear the cached version. I have to see if it happens again, I could be losing my mind.

<@U6GNQ7JBU> <@U6W3H6YN8> your update to support internal HS tools is published, if anyone at HS wants to force the update <https://github.com/williamspiro/HubSpot-Developer-Extension/wiki/How-to-manually-force-Google-Chrome-to-update-your-extensions>
Here's mine: <https://github.com/ajlaporte>
you see my awesome 1 repo thats totally blank lol
